tr.tran: weight to be borne or conveyed

examples: the system broke down under excessive loads
tr.tran: a quantity that can be processed or transported at one time
goods carried by a large vehicle

examples: he got a load on and started a brawl
tr.tran: an amount of alcohol sufficient to intoxicate
the power output of a generator or power plant

examples: that's a load off my mind

tr.tran: a deposit of valuable ore occurring within definite boundaries separating it from surrounding rocks
the front part of a guided missile or rocket or torpedo that carries the nuclear or explosive charge or the chemical or biological agents
electrical device to which electrical power is delivered
fill or place a load on

sent.eng_sent: The three men seemed to have finished loading the truck.
Mr. Dambar had loaded his plate with lasagne.

tran_entry.tran: If you load a vehicle or a container, you put a large quantity of things into it

sent.eng_sent: He drove by with a big load of hay.

tran_entry.tran: A load is something, usually a large quantity or heavy object, which is being carried
If you refer to a load of people or things or loads of them, you are emphasizing that there are a lot of them

sent.eng_sent: I knew how to load and handle a gun.

tran_entry.tran: When someone loads a weapon such as a gun, they put a bullet or missile in it so that it is ready to use

sent.eng_sent: A photographer from the newspaper was loading his camera with film.

tran_entry.tran: To load a camera or other piece of equipment means to put film, tape, or data into it so that it is ready to use

sent.eng_sent: She's taking some of the load off the secretaries.

tran_entry.tran: You can refer to the amount of work you have to do as a <b>load</b

sent.eng_sent: An efficient bulb may lighten the load of power stations.

tran_entry.tran: The load of a system or piece of equipment, especially a system supplying electricity or a computer, is the extent to which it is being used at a particular time

sent.eng_sent: Some of these chairs have flattened feet which spread the load on the ground.

tran_entry.tran: The load on something is the amount of weight that is pressing down on it or the amount of strain that it is under
